title: Basic Counting (ひとつ、ふたつ…とお)
explanation: Used to count things up to ten. Eleven and higher use normal numbers.

title: Counter Suffixes
explanation: Special counters are used depending on the type of item being counted.

title: Usage of Quantifiers
explanation: Quantifiers (number + counter) usually go before verbs they modify.

examples.japanese: りんごを4つ買いました。
外国人の学生が2人います。
国で2か月日本語を勉強しました。
examples.english: I studied Japanese for two months in my country.

title: Interrogatives
explanation: Different words are used to ask 'how many' or 'how long'.

examples.japanese: みかんをいくつ買いましたか。
examples.english: How many mandarin oranges did you buy?

examples.japanese: この会社に外国人が何人いますか。
examples.english: How many foreigners are there in this company?

examples.japanese: 毎晩何時間日本語を勉強しますか。
examples.english: How many hours do you study Japanese every night?

examples.japanese: どのくらい日本語を勉強しましたか。
examples.english: How long did you study Japanese?
I studied it for three years.

examples.japanese: 大阪から東京までどのくらいかかりますか。
examples.english: How long does it take from Osaka to Tokyo?

examples.japanese: ･･･新幹線で2時間半かかります。
examples.english: It takes two and a half hours by Shinkansen.

examples.japanese: 学校に先生が30人ぐらいいます。
examples.english: There are about thirty teachers in our school.

title: Quantifier (period) に V
explanation: Used to express how often something happens.

examples.english: I go to the movies twice a month.

title: だけ (Only)
explanation: Indicates exclusivity. Used after quantifiers or nouns.

examples.japanese: パワー電気に外国人の社員が1人だけいます。
examples.en: There is only one foreign employee in Power Electric.

examples.japanese: 休みは日曜日だけです。
